Articles.Content:
Hey y'all,

Just downloaded the game and anxious to learn all there is about flying rockets into space and building them.

Ever since the Space Shuttle, I've always been fan of space exploration along with.

Also been a fan of model rocketry, building and flying rockets and then watching them land with a parachute or streamer.

Looking forward to advice and people teaching me.

Welcome! If you have any specific questions, ask away. We are happy to help=)

Also... You're ours now. MUAHAHA

Welcome to the community!

The game tutorials provide a lot of help, but they are modestly outdated, and there isn't a tutorial for everything.

I recommend watching Scott Manley's videos as he has a bunch of tutorials that are REAALLLLYYYYY helpful.

Just ask me if you need any help

Yep, Scott Manley is THE guide to almost everything if you don't mind the time and bandwidth for all those videos.

In general, if you're looking for a tutorial on anything the best place to look is The Drawing Board on these forums, which lists almost all of them, including mine.

Mods are nearly essential additions to this game, at least for me. A very helpful one that I recommend downloading once you get the hang of the game is 

<a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/18230-0-24-2-Kerbal-Engineer-Redux-v0-6-2-10-and-v1-0-8-1">Kerbal Engineer Redux</a>

. It makes designing efficient craft much easier.

Anyways, have fun!

FIFY. BB-code wraps links in [ URL]...[ /URL] tags (without the spaces) rather than as HTML anchors. There is a 'globe' button above the editor when you type a post that inserts this for you.
